required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Estetrol for the Treatment of Moderate to Severe Vasomotor Symptoms in Postmenopausal Women
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Double-blind Placebo Controlled Phase 3 Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Estetrol for the Treatment of Moderate to Severe Vasomotor Symptoms in Postmenopausal Women (E4Comfort Study II)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a two-part study designed to evaluate the effect of Estetrol (E4) 15 or 20 mg, or placebo on the severity and frequency of vasomotor symptoms (VMS) (Efficacy Study Part) and the safety of E4 20 mg (Safety Study Part).

detailed_description.textblock:
"This is a two-part study:
- The first part is the Efficacy Study mainly designed to evaluate the frequency and severity of vasomotor symptoms [VMS] in both hysterectomized and non hysterectomized postmenopausal participants after treatment with two doses of E4 (15 mg or 20 mg) or placebo for 12 consecutive weeks. Thereafter treatment will proceed for a total duration of 52 weeks, to continue the evaluation of secondary efficacy, safety and the effect on the endometrium. For endometrial protection, all non-hysterectomized subjects will receive treatment with 200 mg progesterone (P4) once daily for 14 consecutive days, after completion of the E4/placebo treatment.
- The second part is the Safety Study designed to evaluate the general safety, secondary efficacy (Lipid, glucose metabolism, health-related quality of life [HRQoL] and treatment satisfaction [TS]) after treatment with E4 20 mg for one year in hysterectomized postmenopausal participants."

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: There are 3 blinded arms in the Efficacy part and 1 open-labeled arm in the Safety part.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: There are 3 blinded arms in the Efficacy part and 1 open-labeled arm in the Safety part.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in weekly frequency of moderate to severe vasomotor symptoms (VMS) from Baseline to Week 4 (Efficacy part)
primary_outcome.description: The weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Baseline and Week 4 is defined as the total number (sum) of all recorded moderate to severe VMS experienced during the last 7 consecutive days prior randomization for Baseline and at Week 4. Mean change = mean weekly frequency at Week 4 - mean weekly frequency at Baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in weekly frequency of moderate to severe vasomotor symptoms (VMS) from Baseline to Week 12 (Efficacy part)
primary_outcome.description: The weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Baseline and Week 12 is defined as the total number (sum) of all recorded moderate to severe VMS experienced during the last 7 consecutive days prior randomization for Baseline and at Week 12. Mean change = mean weekly frequency at Week 12 - mean weekly frequency at Baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in severity of moderate to severe vasomotor symptoms (VMS) from Baseline to Week 4 (Efficacy part)
primary_outcome.description: The severity score is derived as follows: mild = 1, moderate = 2, and severe = 3. The mean severity score of VMS at Baseline and Week 4 is defined as the arithmetic mean of the daily severity score values of moderate and severe VMS observed from the last 7 days prior randomization for Baseline and of mild, moderate and severe VMS observed at Week 4. Baseline severity score = [(2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS)]/ (total number of moderate + severe VMS). Week 4 severity score = [(1 x number of mild VMS) + (2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS)]/ (total number of mild + moderate + severe VMS). Mean change = mean severity score at Week 4 - mean severity score at Baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in severity of moderate to severe vasomotor symptoms (VMS) from Baseline to Week 12 (Efficacy part)
primary_outcome.description: The severity score is derived as follows: mild = 1, moderate = 2, and severe = 3. The mean severity score of VMS at Baseline and Week 12 is defined as the arithmetic mean of the daily severity score values of moderate and severe VMS observed from the last 7 days prior randomization for Baseline and of mild, moderate and severe VMS observed at Week 12. Baseline severity score = [(2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS)]/ (total number of moderate + severe VMS). Week 12 severity score = [(1 x number of mild VMS) + (2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS)]/ (total number of mild + moderate + severe VMS). Mean change = mean severity score at Week 12 - mean severity score at Baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) (Safety part)
primary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs) are those adverse events occurring from time point of first ingestion of the study until last visit or any event already present that worsens in either intensity or frequency following exposure to the treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with changes in physical and gynecological examination results (Safety part)
primary_outcome.description: Physical examination will include an examination of general appearance, head, eyes, ears, nose, throat, skin neck, lungs, breast, lymph nodes, abdomen, and the cardiovascular musculoskeletal and neurological systems. Gynecological examination will include a manual pelvic examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with changes in vital sign results (Safety part)
primary_outcome.description: Vital signs will include height, body weight, body mass index, sitting systolic and diastolic blood pressures, and heart rate.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with changes in electrocardiogram (ECG) results (Safety part)
primary_outcome.description: The ECG interpretation scheme will include the analysis of the morphology, rhythm, conduction, ST segment, PR, QRS, QT and corrected QT (QTc) intervals, T waves, U waves and the presence or absence of any pathological changes.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with changes in mammography results (Safety part)
Number of participants with changes in breast examination results (Safety part)
primary_outcome.description: Breast examination will include a manual breast examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with changes in routine clinical laboratory test (hematology and chemistry) results (Safety part)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from Baseline to Week 1 in the weekly frequency of moderate to severe vasomotor symptoms (VMS) (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Baseline and Week 1 is defined as the total number (sum) of all recorded moderate to severe VMS experienced during the last 7 consecutive days prior randomization for Baseline and at Week 1. Mean change = mean weekly frequency at Week 1 - mean weekly frequency at Baseline

secondary_outcome.description: The severity score is derived as follows: mild = 1, moderate = 2, and severe = 3. The mean severity score of VMS at Baseline and Week 12 is defined as the arithmetic mean of the daily severity score values of moderate and severe VMS observed from the last 7 days prior randomization for Baseline and of mild, moderate and severe VMS observed at Week 12. Week 12 severity score = [(1 x number of mild VMS) + (2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS)]/ (total number of mild + moderate + severe VMS). Mean change = mean severity score at Week 12 - mean severity score at Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from Baseline to Week 1 in the weekly frequency and severity of moderate and severe vasomotor symptoms (VMS) (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: This endpoint also called VMS weekly weighted score takes into account both the frequency and the severity of VMS. The weekly frequency and severity of moderate and severe VMS at Baseline and at Week 1 is defined as the total number (sum) of all recorded moderate to severe VMS experienced during the last 7 consecutive days prior randomization for Baseline and at Week 1. The severity score is derived as follows: mild = 1, moderate = 2, and severe = 3. The weekly weighted score will be computed as follows: Baseline weekly weighted score = (2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS) Week 1 weekly weighted score = (2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS) Mean change = mean weekly weighted score at Week 1 - mean weekly weighted score at at Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from Baseline to Week 2 in the weekly frequency and severity of moderate and severe vasomotor symptoms (VMS) (Efficacy part)

The severity score is derived as follows: mild = 1, moderate = 2, and severe = 3. The weekly weighted score will be computed as follows: Baseline weekly weighted score = (2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS) Week 2 weekly weighted score = (2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS) Mean change = mean weekly weighted score at Week 2 - mean weekly weighted score at at Baseline

secondary_outcome.description: This endpoint also called VMS weekly weighted score takes into account both the frequency and the severity of VMS. The weekly frequency and severity of moderate and severe VMS at Baseline and at Week 12 is defined as the total number (sum) of all recorded moderate to severe VMS experienced during the last 7 consecutive days prior randomization for Baseline and at Week 12. The severity score is derived as follows: mild = 1, moderate = 2, and severe = 3. The weekly weighted score will be computed as follows: Baseline weekly weighted score = (2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS) Week 12 weekly weighted score = (2 x number of moderate VMS) + (3 x number of severe VMS) Mean change = mean weekly weighted score at Week 12 - mean weekly weighted score at at Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with 50% reduction from Baseline in the weekly frequency of moderate to severe vasomotor symptoms (VMS) at Week 4 (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Baseline and Week 4 is defined as the total number (sum) of all recorded moderate to severe VMS experienced during the last 7 consecutive days prior randomization (Baseline) and days 22 to 28 (Week 4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with 50% reduction from Baseline in the weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Week 12 (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Baseline and Week 12 is defined as the total number (sum) of all recorded moderate to severe VMS experienced during the last 7 consecutive days prior randomization (Baseline) and days 78 to 84 (Week 12).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with 75% reduction from Baseline in the weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Week 4 (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Baseline and Week 4 is defined as the total number (sum) of all recorded moderate to severe VMS experienced during the last 7 consecutive days prior randomization (Baseline) and days 22 to 28 (Week 4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with 75% reduction from Baseline in the weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Week 12 (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at baseline and W eek 12 is defined as the total number (sum) of all recorded moderate to severe VMS experienced during the last 7 consecutive days prior randomization (baseline) and days 78 to 84 (week 12).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with a clinically important difference (CID) compared to Baseline in the weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Week 4 using the Clinical Global Impression (CGI) questionnaire (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI score is a seven point scale in which subjects were asked to rate the total improvement, whether or not in her judgment it was due entirely to drug treatment, compared to her condition at admission to the study. Scale: Very much improved, Much improved, Minimally improved, No change, Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse. Results for the top two responses - Very Much Improved and Much Improved, and No Change or Worsening (Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse) - were combined for each Estetrol treatment groups compare to placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with a clinically important difference (CID) compared to baseline in the weekly frequency of moderate to severe VMS at Week 12 using the Clinical Global Impression (CGI) questionnaire (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI score is a seven point scale in which subjects were asked to rate the total improvement, whether or not in her judgment it was due entirely to drug treatment, compared to her condition at admission to the study. Scale: Very much improved, Much improved, Minimally improved, No change, Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse. Results for the top two responses - Very Much Improved and Much Improved, and No Change or Worsening (Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse) - were combined for each Estetrol treatment groups compare to placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum concentration of Prothrombin fragment 1+2 (Efficacy part)
Endogenous thrombin potential (ETP)-based activated Protein C sensitivity ratio (APCsr ETP) (Efficacy part)
Activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) based activated Protein C resistance (APCr) (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration of anti-thrombin III (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration of Protein-C (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration of free Protein-S (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration of factor VIII (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration of angiotensinogen (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration Sex Hormone Binding Globulin (SHBG) (Efficacy part)
Plasma concentration of triglycerides (Efficacy part)
Plasma concentration of high-density lipoprotein (HDL)-cholesterol (Efficacy part)
Plasma concentration of low-density lipoprotein (LDL)-cholesterol (Efficacy part)
Plasma concentration of lipoprotein(a) (Efficacy part)
Total cholesterol/HDL-cholesterol ratio (Efficacy part)
Plasma concentration of total cholesterol (Efficacy part)
Plasma concentration of fasting glucose (Efficacy part)
Plasma concentration of insulin (Efficacy part)
Plasma concentration of glycated hemoglobin (Efficacy part)
Homeostasis model assessment-estimated insulin resistance (HOMA-IR) (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration of procollagen I N-propeptide (PINP) (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration of C-terminal telopeptide type 1 (CTX-1) (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration of calcium (Efficacy part)
Serum concentration of Vitamine D (Efficacy part)
Health-related quality of life assessment using the Menopause-specific Quality of Life (MENQOL) questionnaire (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The MENQOL is self-administered questionnaire which assessed changes in quality of life over a one-month period. It is composed of 29 questions indicating if subject experienced the problem (Yes/No) and if Yes, rating scale ranged from 0=Not bothered at all to 6=Extremely bothered. For analysis, the original scores were converted to the analysis score ranging from 1-8 where No=1, 0=2, 1=3...and 6=8. The scale contains four domains: vasomotor, psychosocial, physical and sexual. Each domain is scored separately. Vasomotor domain score is mean of = Q1,Q2, Q3, with 1 being "not at all bothered" and 8 being "extremely bothered".

secondary_outcome.measure: Total score in treatment satisfaction using the Clinical Global Impression (CGI)questionnaire (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI score is a seven point scale in which subjects were asked to rate the total improvement, whether or not in her judgment it was due entirely to drug treatment, compared to her condition at admission to the study. Scale: Very much improved, Much improved, Minimally improved, No change, Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse. Results for the top two responses - Very Much Improved and Much Improved, and No Change or Worsening (Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse) - were combined for each estetrol treatment groups compare to placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Follow-up visit (up to Week 56)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent AEs (TEAEs) are those adverse events occurring from time point of first ingestion of the study until last visit or any event already present that worsens in either intensity or frequency following exposure to the treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with changes in physical and gynecological examination results (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: Physical examination will include an examination of general appearance, head, eyes, ears, nose, throat, skin neck, lungs, breast, lymph nodes, abdomen, and the cardiovascular musculoskeletal and neurological systems. Gynecological examination will include a manual pelvic examination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with changes in vital sign results (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: Vital signs will include height, body weight, body mass index, sitting systolic and diastolic blood pressures, and heart rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with changes in electrocardiogram (ECG) results (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: The ECG interpretation scheme will include the analysis of the morphology, rhythm, conduction, ST segment, PR, QRS, QT and QTc intervals, T waves, U waves and the presence or absence of any pathological changes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with changes in mammography results (Efficacy part)
Number of participants with changes in breast examination results (Efficacy part)
Number of subjects with changes in routine clinical laboratory test results (Efficacy part)
Mean endometrial thickness (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: Endometrial thickness will be assessed by transvaginal ultrasound (TVUS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Endometrial biopsy histology at Screening and Week 53 (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: Endometrial biopsies will be centrally evaluated by 3 independent expert pathologists from different institutions. Two independent pathologists will assess the slides from the endometrial biopsies. In case of discrepancy between both pathologists' assessments, a third independent pathologist will assess the slide. If there is no agreement among the three pathologists, the most severe pathologic diagnosis will be used as the final diagnosis. Endometrial biopsy will be classified using criteria described in Blaustein's Pathology text into 1 of following 11 categories: Cat.0: No tissue; Cat.1: Tissue insufficient for diagnosis; Cat.2: Atrophic; Cat 3: Inactive; Cat 4: Proliferative; Cat 5: Secretory; Cat 6: Menstrual type; Cat 7: Simple hyperplasia without atypia; Cat 8: Simple hyperplasia with atypia; Cat 9: Complex hyperplasia without atypia; Cat 10: Complex hyperplasia with atypia; and Cat 11: Carcinoma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of women with vaginal bleeding and/or spotting during each 28-day cycle of treatment with E4 (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: Vaginal bleeding will be daily recorded by the participant on the diary. Absence or occurrence of vaginal bleeding/ spotting will be assessed using the scale below: 0 = Absence of vaginal bleeding or spotting; 1 = Spotting: evidence of minimal blood loss requiring none or at most one pad, tampon or panty liner per day; 2 = Bleeding: evidence of blood loss requiring more than one pad, tampon or panty liner per day.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of women with amenorrhea (absence of any bleeding or spotting) during each 28-day cycle of treatment with E4 (Efficacy part)
secondary_outcome.description: Vaginal bleeding will be daily recorded by the participant on the diary. Absence or occurrence of vaginal bleeding/ spotting will be assessed using the scale below: 0 = Absence of vaginal bleeding or spotting; 1 = Spotting: evidence of minimal blood loss requiring none or at most one pad, tampon or panty liner per day; 2 = Bleeding: evidence of blood loss requiring more than one pad, tampon or panty liner per day.

It is composed of 29 questions indicating if subject experienced the problem (Yes/No) and if Yes, rating scale ranged from 0=Not bothered at all to 6=Extremely bothered. For analysis, the original scores were converted to the analysis score ranging from 1-8 where No=1, 0=2, 1=3...and 6=8. The scale contains four domains: vasomotor, psychosocial, physical and sexual. Each domain is scored separately. Vasomotor domain score is mean of = Q1,Q2, Q3, with 1 being "not at all bothered" and 8 being "extremely bothered".

secondary_outcome.measure: Total score in treatment satisfaction using the Clinical Global Impression (CGI) questionnaire (Safety part)
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI score is a seven point scale in which subjects were asked to rate the total improvement, whether or not in her judgment it was due entirely to drug treatment, compared to her condition at admission to the study. Scale: Very much improved, Much improved, Minimally improved, No change, Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse. Results for the top two responses - Very Much Improved and Much Improved, and No Change or Worsening (Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse) - were combined for each estetrol treatment groups compare to placebo.

arm_group.description: Estetrol (E4) 15 mg will be administered orally once daily for 52 consecutive weeks.
Estetrol (E4) 20 mg will be administered orally once daily for 52 consecutive weeks.
Placebo will be administered orally once daily for 52 consecutive weeks.
Estetrol (E4) 20 mg will be administered orally once daily for 52 consecutive weeks.

intervention.description: Estetrol oral tablet will be administered orally once daily.
Placebo oral tablet will be administered orally once daily.
